alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:07AM EST until December 20 at 1:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey...New York... Ramapo River near Mahwah affecting Rockland, Passaic, Orange and Bergen Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Mahwah...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River near Mahwah. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Major flooding along Route 202 and Route 17 intersection. Road closed. Flooding along Riverview Drive and along Halifax Road and Bridle Path Lane. Flooding on Brakeshoe Place, Brook Street and Catherine Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM EST Monday was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 5.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 03/31/1951. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Ramapo River Mahwah 8.0 10.6 Mon 11 pm ES 7.5 6.5 MSG &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at noon EST.
